channel.title: Posts on Westview Bridge Club
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Westview Bridge Club

item.title: Bringing Generations Together Through Bridge
item.description: Laurel Parc Community Volunteering Event 2/5/2023: This is our first community volunteering event at Laurel Parc Senior Living Center. We met many expert players and learned a lot during this community event.

item.title: 1/9/2023 Meeting and First BBO Tournament
item.description: Great first meeting back from winter break! More new members, some solid practice rounds and First Bridge Base Online Tournaments.

item.title: Funbridge Deal Autocollection
item.description: This is a tutorial on how to use the funbridge autocollection bot to autocollect daily deals on Windows and Ubuntu Linux.

item.title: First Funbridge Tournament
item.description: Hello and welcome to our Bridge club! As a member of the club, I have to say that playing Bridge is an absolute blast. It’s a game that’s fun, challenging, and rewarding, and there’s always something new to learn and enjoy.

item.title: First Blog Post-12/12/2022 Meeting
item.description: Hello and welcome to our Bridge club! This is our first blog of a bridge club meeting.

item.title: How to Play Bridge
item.description: Getting Started This is a tutorial on how to get started playing bridge on a casual level. We recommend that you start by learning to play, then bidding, and finally if you are really up for it scoring. Scoring is complex and the rules for it change between different variants of bridge, so the best way to do scoring is to just use the score sheet. Materials 4 Players Standard 52 Deck of Playing Cards Paper and Pencil(for scoring) Bridge is a card game played with 4 players divided into 2 teams of 2 called pairs/partners.
